name: npm
description: 1. What is npm?   - npm (Node Pakage Manager) is a package manager for the Javascript programming lamguage.   - npm is the world's largest Software Registry.   - NPM consists of three main parts:       1. Website (npmjs.com)       - The official npm website allows users to discover, browse, and search for packages.       - lets users create and manage accounts, as well as publish and manage packages     2. CLI (Command Line Interface)         - The npm CLI is a tool used to interact with npm directly from the command line.     3. Registry         - The npm registry is a massive public database(online repository) of JavaScript packages
